main_definition: To make a low, continuous humming or murmuring sound.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Feeling excited or energetic about something
meanings_and_examples.example: The buzz around the new product launch made everyone eager to try it.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To create a lively atmosphere with conversation and activity
meanings_and_examples.example: There was a great buzz in the room during the party as people mingled and talked.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A sound made by bees or other insects when they are flying around
meanings_and_examples.example: I could hear the buzz of bees as I walked through the garden.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To spread information quickly and widely, often with little scrutiny or fact-checking
meanings_and_examples.example: The celebrity gossip created a huge buzz in the media before any details were confirmed.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A state of being busy or occupied
meanings_and_examples.example: After hours of work, I felt completely buzzed from all the tasks accomplished.
